_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Newly installed fogging system for Ammonia Tank
_prev_prog_3.Description: The Magnablend Liquid Blending Facility's Prevention Program is composed of the following elements, which are all part of the Process Safety Management (PSM) program.  This program follows the requirements set forth in 29 CFR 1910.119:  1) Employees participate in the elements of this safety and release prevention program wherever possible; 2) Training is provided for operators and maintenance personnel; 3) Process Safety Information (PSI) is maintained on ammonia hazards and the ammonia system equipment; 4) A Process Hazard Analysis(PHA) of the ammonia system was conducted and is periodically reviewed to ensure adequacy of controls; 5) The Mechanical Integrity program ensures the system continues to operate as designed; 6) Operating and Maintenance procedures provide operators and maintenance staff the information necessary to safely operate and maintain the system; 7) Contractors working on or near the ammonia system are selected for safety performance, and are briefed on the hazards and safety requirements of the job; 8) Hot Work Permits are required whenever welding, cutting, grinding or other activities are conducted that could generate sparks and start a fire; 9) The Management of Change (MOC) program requires that the impact of changes to the ammonia system be evaluated and approved prior to the work being conducted; 10) Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR) are conducted prior to restart of the system after modifications to ensure that impacts of the change are addressed; 11) Incident investigations are conducted for incidents involving ammonia releases and near misses that endanger employees or the public, if such an incident were to occur; 12) Compliance Audits are conducted every three years to ensure that the prevention program is meeting its objectives; 13) Emergency Planning and Response ensures that employees are

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EPA Risk Management Program Executive Summary

1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Magnablend, Inc. is a privately held, chemical manufacturing, blending, and packaging company located in Waxahachie, Texas.  Magnablend complies with applicable federal, state and local regulations.  All Magnablend employees are informed of hazards in the workplace and are trained accordingly.  Magnablend has procedures in place to safely remove employees from the plant in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and response procedures.

2. Facility and Regulated Substances

Magnablend manufactures specialty chemical products for its customers utilizing customer formulations and specifications.  Magnablend specializes in oil field chemicals, agricultural fertilizers, construction chemicals, water treating chemicals, and industrial cleaning compounds.  Anhydrous ammonia is utilized as a raw material in many of the products as a source of nitrogen and pH control.  

3. Worst-Case and Alternate-Case Release Scenarios

Please reference onsite data (Volume 1: Risk Management Plan) at Magnablend?s liquid facility.

4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention

Magnablend, Inc. complies with the OSHA Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standard relative to anhydrous ammonia. Therefore, this facility has programs to ensure proper operation and maintenance of the ammonia storage and piping systems.   All operators associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the system.

The storage tank and piping system at this facility has been designed and constructed using good engineering practices and to conform to industry standards. The system includes ammonia detection devices near the storage tank, an excess- flow emergency shutdown valve located on the main line outside th

e building, an emergency stop button located on the wall in the production facility, an automatic water fog / sprinkler system, and 2 safety relief valves to avert serious system overpressure.  Regular inspections of the storage tank, piping system, and mitigation equipment ensures ongoing system integrity.

5. Five Year Accident History

During the past five years this facility has had no accidental releases of ammonia.

6. Emergency Response Program

Magnablend maintains an excellent relationship with the Waxahachie fire department and local authorities.  In the event of an emergency, Magnablend will initiate an evacuation of the facility and notify the proper authorities, including the Waxahachie Fire Department and LEPC.  Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a).
